data.text: I purchased a new Samsung device for the holidays. My previous tablet had zero problems transferring my data. Unfortunately, that is NOT the case this time. I follow all the prompts, but for some reason, the wireless transfer gets to 5.4% before saying the connection is lost. I have tried numerous times with no success. HOW does the connection keep getting dropped when the devices are literally right next to each other?! Samsung has been losing cool points lately!
data.replyText: Hi. We're sorry for your inconvenience. There is a need to analyze log files to find out the cause and resolve the problem. Could you please contact to our email(sswitch.cs@samsung.com) for further assistance? Our team is going to try our best to resolve the problem. Thank you.

data.text: February 2024. Smart Switch transferred apps and data from Samsung Tab A to Samsung Tablet S6 Lite with ease - quickly and efficiently. Be aware, however, that the Samsung apps for the S6 are not the same as the apps on the Tab A. Clock, Calendar, and Contacts have a different look and feel about them. I much, very much, prefer the Tab A apps. I suspect the S6 apps were originally designed for phones while the Tab A apps are more suited for tablets.

Seems to copy almost all apps and data. CAUTION- Turn WiFi to DHCP on the old phone because it over-writes your WiFi settings on the new phone then disconnects for IP conflict if it's set to static IP. When using a USB-C data cable with a lot of data be sure to have a wireless charger set up! When transferring files is interrupted it doesn't pick up where it was interrupted so you could end up with a lot of duplicate or triplicate files. Sure beats doing it all manually though!!

I don't get all the negative reviews. I used it to transfer data from my old Galaxy phone to the new one and It worked like a charm for me. It did take some time to transfer data but it wasn't more than an hour. I was also transfer pretty heavy size of data. All of my files, device settings and even the app data was transferred without much hassle. Totally loved it!

The App, is as useless, as a Comb is to a Baldmans Head. It only works if you have a higher Android Phone UI, depending on your Model Type; otherwise, it won't work with a much older Cell Phone, with a less UI, let alone, if you don't have wireless, because it does NOT transfer data. Better, to Screenshot or USB, from another source all of your important Passwords, from your Apps, Contacts, etc., to your Phone manually; itwould probably less risk of bringing unnecessary junk to your new Phone.
data.replyText: Hello, we apologize for the inconvenience. It is difficult to provide guidance based on the information you shared. We will help you if you share detailed information, including the type of previous device you are currently using (OS/model name), screenshots of the problem situation, and problem app, by email (sswitch.cs@samsung.com). thank you

data.text: It does help, but the ads are annoying AND misleading. Some look like part of the app, and someone lacking my keen technical acuity ;) could get confused and screw things up. Ads make it quite cumbersome. Cabled transfer did not work at all. The app is essential, and does work well, but it doesn't have to be this difficult.
data.replyText:
Hi, We're sorry for your inconvenience.
We'll strive to provide better service.
Thank you.

data.text: This is the 2nd time I've used this to migrate to a newer phone. First time no issues and it worked well. This time there are some issues (note 8 to Note 20 Ultra) I wanted to use a cable as I don't have a secure wifi at work. The app won't start sending data via the cable, so get home on a secure wifi and it still won't start data transfer. Best guess at this point is that what the app wants is internet access vs just a wifi which is disappointing as I use my phone for my limited internet use
data.replyText: Hello, We're sorry for your inconvenience. There is a need to analyze log files to find out the cause and resolve the problem. Could you please contact to our email(sswitch.cs@samsung.com) for further assistance? Our team is going to try our best to resolve the problem. Thank you.

data.text: I have used this app twice before without a hitch. With this one I have spent over 24 hours just trying to update the app on the new phone with no success and can't get passed it in the setup. Gone back and started from beginning several times, new phone (same as one Im replacing) will not let me bypass this step. The more technology they put on these phones and the more they "improve" the technology already on them the more problems you have and the less you can use the phone for anything.
data.replyText:
Hi, We're sorry for your inconvenience.
We're sorry for your inconvenience.

data.text: This is an awesome little app..!!! I wish they had this for all of my previous upgrade phones. It made moving everything from my old phone to my new phone SO MUCH EASIER 😀! Seriously, it is perfect for everyone - especially those with little - to no - experience with technology. Also works well as backup software, with 2 - step verification built into the process for security. A good app 👍

Getting worse. When I switched over from my Note 10+ to S22U in 2022, Smart Switch made a complete copy with no problem. It got my launcher, my keyboard settings, etc. This time around going to my S24U, loads of things including those I named just didn't. I had to set them up. It also forgot settings for a slew of apps, including Gboard and Textra.
data.replyText:
"Hi, We're sorry for your inconvenience.
It's hard to reproduce and check the symptom with your description only.
Please contact to our email(sswitch.cs@samsung.com) for further assistance.
Thank you."

data.text: Smart switch is barely working as its supposed to anymore!! Some apps data actually get transferred and more than half of the apps data never get transferred just installed! One example is on pokemon go when I switched from A01 to S20 the transfer got all the data from the old device but now its not working anymore. FIX THIS!!
data.replyText: Hi. We're sorry for your inconvenience. It's hard to reproduce and check the symptom with your description only. Please contact to our email(sswitch.cs@samsung.com) for further assistance. Thank you

data.text: Moved from a Z fold 3 to a Z Fold 5 with no issues. It does take a while to transfer my data over, even while using a cable. All my stuff was transferred over from my old phone to the new one in about an hour. I just let the phone move everything back into place. The only thing that was annoying is you would have to re login into all your apps. Also, make sure you are using the most current version of the app and using a good quality cable. I was using an Anker USB C cable. Good luck!

Not optimal or time saving. You would think Samsung could do better with this app. Transferring the data from one phone to the other sounds good in theory, but if all of the former preferences, passwords, messages don't go over, it's useless. I have spent three days resetting all of my notification sounds, text messages which took 3 attempts and re-signing in to all of my apps which meant looking up all of the passwords. I might have been just better off reinstalling everything on my own.

this is a major disappointment. only works with wifi transfer from phone to phone. the wired feature doesn't work, and neither does the USB backup data. tried several data cables and it would always fail at 51% and the USB storage would fail at 43% tried ssd, USB, and nvme encounter. nothing worked. Samsung really needs to get it together. this is a rather fundamental feature for getting a new device and only 1 feature works. major disappointment samsung.
data.replyText: Hi. We're sorry for your inconvenience. There is a need to analyze log files to find out the cause and resolve the problem. Could you please contact to our email(sswitch.cs@samsung.com) for further assistance? Our team is going to try our best to resolve the problem. Thank you.

data.text: Has worked wonders for me in the past and recently a real miracle. My phone screen broke last week but it was still operational to the touch. I was able to use Smart Switch with its mostly chonky buttons, simple interface, by just following Youtube guides so I could see where to tap. This got me onto the new phone and everything was nearly identical to my old phone. I had to re-login and fix my ringtone, little stuff, but icons in the same spots, all apps, all photos saved. Love It <3

The basic "look and feel" and settings get cloned quite well. Photos as well. But apps? I had to manually log in to every single one using username, password, TLA etc... Fingerprint or face recognition didn't work, I had to set it up from scratch and manually enable in every single app. In some cases uninstall and reinstall was necessary to make apps working again. Total nightmare. Cloned S10+ to S23+ I also intentionally unchecked transferring my music to save some time, worked partially only.

There is no reason to move your backup functionality out of the wear app, other than to get more of my data, which you require (sms, photos, notifications, contacts, nearby devices, calendar and call logs) access to in order to regain my watch backup functionality. Removing functionality is never ok and this is just a transparent data grab.
data.replyText: Hi, we apologize for the inconvenience. It is difficult to provide guidance based on the information you shared. data.text: I've been trying for 2 days to switch my information. The app keeps closing. HORRIBLE. I have smart switch downloaded on both devices. After opening the app and attempting to transfer information from my old device to my new device, the app stops after 26%. I received a pop-up message that the app continues to close do I want to put the app in "deep sleep." AGAIN it's useless. I've used both the wireless and cable methods.
data.replyText: Hi. We're sorry for your inconvenience. It's hard to reproduce and check the symptom with your description only. Could you please explain the problem in more detail? Please contact to our email(sswitch.cs@samsung.com) for further assistance. Thank you.

data.text: I have had the worst experience trying to transfer between Samsung galaxy devices. I have started and restarted the painstakingly long transfer process 3 times and it has stopped from errors due to losing connection every time. It was almost done and had taken nearly 4 hours the last time and failed. It doesn't even save partial progress! Horrible app. Useless af
data.replyText: Hi. We're sorry for your inconvenience. It's hard to reproduce and check the symptom with your description only. Could you please explain the problem in more detail? Please contact to our email(sswitch.cs@samsung.com) for further assistance. Thank you.

data.text: I switched from an older Moto to a newer Galaxy. After reading the most recent reviews here, I had resigned myself to the possibility that the app wouldn't do its job. Well, the app did its job. All of my photos, messages, and apps were successfully and quickly copied to my new phone. While it's true you have to log into all of your apps again, to me that's just added security.

Used this successfully for several years, then it updated on my MacBook and now it always gives "Change connection mode to transfer media files and try connecting again". I did that. I watched every instructional video and tried other cables and switched all the settings and nothing works. It used to be a useful program and then they updated it and now it will not connect to my Galaxy S20 no matter what. I would give it zero stars if I could.

I gave 2 apps permissions to touch and *only COPY* my files. This one and the smart switch app from "Novus technologies app" only the Samsung smart switch app(this one) actually started working, and now some of my pictures are entirely missing. not even in the trash, just entirely gone. I'll be transferring the rest of my files manually for now on. I suggest y'all do the same Back your stuff up to the cloud
data.replyText: Hi. We're sorry for your inconvenience. It's hard to reproduce and check the symptom with your description only. Could you please explain the problem in more detail? Please contact to our email(sswitch.cs@samsung.com) for further assistance. Thank you.

data.text: Owning a Samsung smart watch has been the worst experience I've had with technology in many years, second only to my experience with my Samsung sound bar. My watch worked perfectly fine, backups were all set. Then suddenly one day I find I have to install this app and give them all my data to have backups. Screw that. I'm just going to get a different smart watch. Screw you Samsung. You make terrible predatory products.
data.replyText:
Hi. To be used fully, Smart Switch app needs to have the following permissions for features and will be used for only those features. [Telephone, Contacts, Calendar, SMS, Storage and Microphone]
Please refer to the description page for more information. Thank you.

data.text: Inadequate instructions. Required multiple connection attempts between the 2 devices despite both being connected to the same wifi network. Excessively long and complicated exchange made worse when the new device didn't acknowledge my Google account and password - requiring me to re-enter the account info with a backup code. Bad app experience and very negative first impression of Samsung as a brand.
data.replyText: Hi. We're sorry for your inconvenience. It's hard to reproduce and check the symptom with your description only. Could you please explain the problem in more detail? Please contact to our email(sswitch.cs@samsung.com) for further assistance. Thank you.

data.text: I can only give it three stars. Yes, it does backup my phone, and yes it does restore my phone, but it does not restore all the settings I had. Amazing how much time is spent trying to get things back to the way I had them. If you need a quick backup in case of issues then this is the way to go. But do not expect your phone or tablet to be restored to the way it was. The best recovery was TWRP which requires Unlock Booltoader and Root. My Samsung is blocked from doing that. That's just too bad.

Biggest piece of garbage ever for transferring data. Can't figure out what phone is sending or receiving no matter the order you do it or opposite phone still can't tell which is which. Very disappointing. And for an actual new phone switch also terrible puts everything in weird places renames and resizes and loses quality on a lot of things even with a wired transfer.
data.replyText: Hi. We're sorry for your inconvenience. It's hard to reproduce and check the symptom with your description only. Could you please explain the problem in more detail? Please contact to our email(sswitch.cs@samsung.com) for further assistance. Thank you.

data.text: Since the latest Wear OS update on my Watch 5 Pro, I'm being forced to use this app to automatically backup my watch. There isn't a button to make it do a backup, and it's been a week since the last backup. I want to do a full restore of my phone which means the watch has to be restored too. I'd like to be able to take a backup of both devices minutes before or at least the same day when I'm doing the restore. Please bring back the backup button.
data.replyText: Hi. We're sorry for your inconvenience. It's hard to reproduce and check the symptom with your description only. Could you please explain the problem in more detail? Please contact to our email(sswitch.cs@samsung.com) for further assistance. Thank you.

data.text: For all the phones they sell, this is trash. Odd and unclear messages in its use. Won't back up onto a network drive. Claims that photos are hidden when they are not (and in some cases there just aren't any photos). Won't back up a secure folder or install on the secure side of your phone to do so. Just doesn't inspire trust. If you want something to transfer your text messages and contacts, then Ok. Otherwise forget this.
data.replyText: Hi, We're sorry for unsatisfactory service. We'll strive to provide better service. Thank you.

data.text: This app just does not work well. Here's why. When I upgraded from a S7 to a A32 5G, it transfered all my files, apps etc. But it also transfered all the S7 system apps to it. (Phone app, and general system apps) It made the experience terrible. Calls were sometimes not received, texts not sending, broken brightness and so on. I got my files and manually transfered them. (After factory reset) and the problems were gone. This *should* be simple for people that aren't tech inclined, but it isen't.
data.replyText:
Hi.
We're sorry for your inconvenience.

Please contact to our email(sswitch.cs@samsung.com) for further assistance.
Thank you.

data.text: After weeks of no watch notifications and an unusable wearable app, wearable is back working but with less features than before. Backups used to be part of the wearable app which didn't need unnecessary permissions. Now it's part of this separate app that requires every permission under the sun just to back up a watch. I can only assume it's to gather more data to sell to ad networks. 0/10 will never buy or recommend another Samsung product.
data.replyText: Hello, We apologize for any inconvenience caused. Smart Switch requires some permissions to backup/restore various types of data. Please understand this. If you have any questions about this, please contact us by email (sswitch.cs@samsung.com) for further assistance. thank you

data.text: This app keeps downloading to my phone no matter how many times I uninstall it. I even turned off automatic updates. No app should be able to download to my phone without permission. EDIT: I don't care what permissions Google may have given the app. I did not give permission to be on my phone. I will continue to remove every time it reinstalls. Stop automatically downloading apps to my phone.
data.replyText: Please understand that the SmartSwitch app cannot be deleted due to Google permission issues. For app capacity issues, you can maintain the app with almost no available space by using the "Press and hold the SmartSwitch icon - exclamation point (!) - more (three dots on the right) - Delete update" menu.

data.text: I DO NOT RECOMMEND. I want to back up my Galaxy 4 watch (WHICH I OWN) to my Google account via my Google Pixel 7 Pro, but Samsung proprietary will not allow. I tried downloading Smart Switch, thinking there may be a setting to do this, but was nonplussed when I found the is no way to back up unless I own a Samsung. I have a Samsung account, Samsung Smart TV... Alas, no way, unless you give Samsung rights to take over your phone- permissions on everything just to find out I cannot do the backup.
data.replyText: Hello, Please use the watch using the Galaxy Wearable app. If backup verification continues to fail, please contact us via email (sswitch.cs@samsung.com). We will provide a solution through log analysis, etc. Thank you

data.text: This app is absolute malware! It showed up in my app drawer out of nowhere and has automatic permissions for everything on my phone. I have no idea what this app does, or where it came from. I have tried to uninstall it but that is not an option. This is my last Samsung device if they're just going to keep loading unrequested software.
data.replyText: The SmartSwitch app can be updated and uninstalled. For app capacity issues, you can maintain the app with almost no available space by using the "Press and hold the SmartSwitch icon - exclamation point (!) - more (three dots on the right) - Delete update" menu. Thank you

data.text: Samsung Switch is awesome! I've had a new Samsung for a while but have had a deep fear of the change. Had so much on my old phone that I didn't want to lose. Finally decided to bite the bullet after reading about this app, although I was very skeptical. Oh my!! I used the WiFi option. It did take a little over an hour but when I opened the new phone....IT LOOKED JUST LIKE THE OLD ONE!! All my apps, pics, games; etc...were not only there but in the same place. Just awesome!!

I've never had a problem and I've used it every year since the S6. I now have 3 Samsungs and none of which have had issues with the app either. There's also no bloatwear so idk what they're talking about. This is one of, if not the most efficient transfer apps actually on Android, and obviously iPhone. If you're having issues with it, I suggest going to your carrier to do the transfer. They are trained and well versed on Smart Switch.

Amazing service!! All of my apps were installed, and the settings of each individual app were identical to my other phone! While Google was restoring my apps/contacts on Note 10, I discovered an app I'd bought years ago was no longer available in the Play Store. I searched for a compatible app while Smart Switch was running but didn't see one. Once Smart Switch finished, the app was installed on my Note 10!! I was even more thrilled when I opened it and saw everything had already been set up!!

Pretty good, but lacks a critical feature. I had no problem connecting via cable, and it was easy enough to transfer contacts, call history, and messages. I was able to pretty much duplicate my old phone, and that is where my major criticism comes. I want to transfer a few of my apps to the new phone, not all of them. If there is an option, it isn't very obvious. My new phone has enough bloatware, I don't want to bog it down with all my old seldom used apps too.

It's alright. It's insane it no longer works on tablets or at least my tablet. Samsung is constantly trying to sell new features but doesn't commit to existing services. Why commit if they don't (360)? If a new device has settings a previous one does not then settings would be overlooked. While copying everything from one device to the next on a personal file is great, you still need to go through all settings to get each individual device the way you want it. App data doesn't back up either.

Pros: Was able to restore all my files, settings, and most of my app data. Cons: Requires you to allow the connection on your old phone, which is difficult to do when your old phone is busted. And if you don't allow the connection fast enough, it will give you an error and make you start over. Some of my app data was still missing. I used the wireless option as I could not get the USB option to work at all.

I had just backed up my phone using Smart Switch and a day later my phone crashed and I had to do a factory reset. Smart Switch worked fantastic at restoring my phone back to the way it was. It restored about 90% of all my settings which saved me a lot of setup time. The only downside that I see is when doing a backup, the percentage indicator and estimated time is way off. This has only happened with the latest updated.
data.replyText:
Hi, Thank you for your interest in Smart Switch.
And We're sorry for unsatisfactory service. We'll strive to provide better service. Thank you.

data.text: This app did not copy from phone to phone. It was supposed to copy one Android to another Android it did not work. There was a whole lot of telling me the phones had to be charged to a certain percentage also, they gave you the option to connect via cables or wireless. I did not have the cables so I used wireless (which is WiFi) it constantly told me that it could not connect even though both phones were connected to the same WiFi. This was a total headache I do not recommend.
data.replyText: Hi. We're sorry for your inconvenience. There is a need to analyze log files to find out the cause and resolve the problem. Could you please contact to our email(sswitch.cs@samsung.com) for further assistance? Our team is going to try our best to resolve the problem. Thank you.

data.text: This app works great. I have no issues with it so far. I have a Samsung Note 10+ and Tab S6. My phone is where most changes happen, like new apps, new Chrome bookmarks added to folders on my home screen, new SMS, etc. However, I like to have my tablet updated with all the changes I make on my phone. I just run Smart Switch periodically, and that takes care of it. At first, my Chrome bookmarks were in the folders on my target device's home screen, but they were grayed out and wouldn't work when pressed. But after giving it some time, they eventually got backed up and worked again. I'm not sure how long that takes - it was a couple of days before I checked them again, but anyway, now they're working. I'm glad I don't have to root my phone or change launchers - Smart Switch seems to do a thorough job of backing everything up using the native Samsung launcher.

This is my second review. The first one was less than favorable. This apps gives you two options for transfer. The first option is a "wireless connection" which simply would not work. The second option is by using a "wired connection" between the two phones. It had a quirk or two at first, but all said and done, it actually worked well. I tried 4 or 5 different apps before realizing this app came with my new phone and would definitely recommend it.
data.replyText:
Hi.
Sorry for your inconvenience. But, it's hard to understand the inconvenience with your description only. Providing the details about it will help us a lot to improve usability of this app. Thank you.

data.text: The app did about 80% of what I expected, so it gets an 80% rating. The only problem was that it did not offer any way to transfer call logs, which is rather odd considering that the capability is specifically mentioned in the description. Anyway, there were no functional issues other than that, and the transfers that did work went without a hitch. (I used the direct wireless method between two Samsung Galaxy phones.)

I can't believe I didn't know this app existed. I just bought the S10 Plus and figured I would try using Smart Switch, not really knowing how well it would work. In a matter of minutes, everything transferred from my S9 Plus to my new one. When I turned my new one on, everything was set up exactly the way it was on my old one. Including the lock screen and home screen wallpaper, my apps were all in the same order they were on the old one. I didn't have to do a thing. 👍🏻👏🏼

I wanted to maybe give 4 stars because when I was attempting to transfer information from an old phone to a new one, it transferred the data of both my old phone and a tablet to my new device. That wasn't the issue of the app though, that was something I didn't realize I was doing. It was a time consuming process, but using the app was very seamless and I was suprised with how smooth my transition was between devices. I will never manually transfer the data over ever again!

I normally don't take time to rate apps. But this had to be done. I've used this app on 3 different occasions. Each time I've had very little to no problems... AT ALL! No information was lost. Everything was set up identical to the old phone. I believe it makes a difference if you prepare the old phone BEFORE starting the initial transfer. Samsung phones literally take care of themselves... if you let them. Good luck All!!

My transfer to my microSD card always gets stuck at 6%. I have no idea what the problem is. Its been happening for a month now. Also a couple suggested features: an auto backup feature that we can choose to turn on or off. We can choose the time and the frequency it updates. Also an option to transfer samsung cloud pictures to the SD card without deleting the current information on it. Thank you!
data.replyText:
Hi.
We're sorry for your inconvenience.
It's hard to reproduce and check the symptom with your description only.
Please contact to our email(sswitch.cs@samsung.com) for further assistance.
Thank you.

data.text: App failed a couple times and had to restart it. The app has only the bare minimum of info to direct a user what to do when and whether there are any pre-requisites (disable screen timeouts, etc.). It looked like it had finished, then I saw in notifications there was still 40% left to go. I'd think I'd need to keep it in proximity for the duration? INFORM YOUR USER!
data.replyText: Hi, We're sorry for unsatisfactory service. We'll strive to provide better service. Thank you.

data.text: Still very impressed. Backed up my previous phone to a new phone, followed the instructions, no issue. Be mindful that the USB cable does not move, else disconnects. Also, one phone must have USB Charging changed to "Data Transfer", else one or both phones will just shut off. After the transfer, give it some time. It took about ½hr after the transfer to be a fully functional clone.

MOST of the photos in my texts did NOT transfer. Just a grey square with a "!" In the middle. I tried everything. I've tried 6 times and it still won't transfer all my MMS pictures! Only a handful transferred the first time. Seems ridiculous that Samsung can't get it right. After searching for a solution it seems it's a random glitch with random solutions that don't work. Come on Samsung! Fix it!
data.replyText: Hi. We're sorry for your inconvenience. There is a need to analyze log files to find out the cause and resolve it. Please contact to our email(sswitch.cs@samsung.com) for further assistance. Thank you.

data.text: Absolutely useless. I have wasted a hour installing and reinstalling and trying to get it to work transferring from a recent Galaxy to a brand new Galaxy, again and again and again, and it literally fails every single time in one of several different ways. Sometimes it won't connect at all. Sometimes the app will just shut off and disappear, sometimes it will connect briefly then crash. Worthless.

From a Note 8 to a Note 10G... It is not as smooth as it should be. It doesn't transfer all of your data, and it doesn't transfer everything in one pass. It takes 2 or 3 tries to get most of the information over. It didn't transfer all of emails and texts. But it seemed to retrieve texts from forgotten people that had been deleted a year ago. Some of my contacts are missing...from my contact list and from my texts. The phone settings weren't transferred like it claimed that it would be.

Doesn't work. Tried cable and wifi options for hours Doesn't usually connect. Got to 5% once, and that was the best it's done before locking up my phone. edit: pretty sure it's a connection issue, since I was working with spotty WiFi and the usb-c connection on my old phone was worn and loose. Wish it would hold its place until it gets connection instead of restart the process. Bumped up the rating to 3 stars since it's a specific flaw instead of being as bad as I'd thought.
data.replyText:
Hi.
We're sorry for your inconvenience.
It's hard to reproduce and check the symptom with your description only.

Thank you.

data.text: 12-25-2020 --- Horrible!!!! The app will not install! After trying over a dozen times, and using the link to common fixes (which is BS)! I have had Samsung for about the last 10 years (whenever they did away with the blackberry), and I have never had any problems...until now! 🤬 UPDATE (12-28-2020): I tried what you suggested, and that also did not work. I got the same message. So apparently your app does not work on the new Samsung phones.

data.text: If only zero stars was an option. Worthless and time consuming. Took hours and anything important was lost. Transferred most of my apps but all my history was lost, like starting from scratch. What a disaster. So much was lost or recovered by other means. You would think the maker of both my previous and current phone could do better. Stick with the cloud.

data.text: useless. Jams up, takes forever, difficulties connecting via wireless or cable. I would give it a -5 update: I've done that, transferring by files, and updated the app in both phones. Still useless. At this point, my next phone will not be another Samsung, even if it has been my choice for the last few years. This time has proven very disappointing.
data.replyText:
Hi.

For further assistance, please contact to our E-mail(sswitch.cs@samsung.com).
Thank you.

data.text: For the most part, it brought almost everything over. Had to reinstall Amazon apps. I did not experience loss of data from my old phone or SD card. Everything was still intact. My rating is based on their permission settings and not carrying all of the apps over. For the life of me, I cannot understand why this app needs full rights to make calls. You are transferring data, not calling my contacts?! I gave permission to everything else but making calls. The app would not open and crashed until I adjusted the permissions and applied yes to all.

Constantly losing connection! I've used the app with a transfer cable and over wifi. In the wifi mode it won't connect the phones half of the time and just gets stuck in searching mode. Once the phones recognize each other (wired or wireless) they will transfer about 30-50% of the data and then get stuck. If you leave it for a while you get an error saying that the connection was lost and the phones can't see each other. Really frustrating!
data.replyText: Hi. We're sorry for your inconvenience. It seems there is a need to analyze log files to find out the cause of problem. Please contact to our email(sswitch.cs@samsung.com) for further assistance. Thank you.

data.text: Just bought the S21 Ultra. I've tried both wireless and wired to transfer from my S10+. Wireless says both phones must be on the same network, which they are. Wired it says my old phones security prevents data transfer. I've turned off any security I can find and nothing. I need my new phone functional for work with the picture on my old phone. So frustrating! Was told this would take almost no time. Get it together at these prices!
data.replyText: Hi. We're sorry for your inconvenience. We want to resolve problem you faced with. But it's a bit hard to reproduce and check the symptom with your description only. We need to analyze a log file. Please contact to our email(sswitch.cs@samsung.com) for further assistance. Thank you.

data.text: Completely screwed up my contacts in Outlook. Very disappointing for an app that is supposedly purpose built to sync with Outlook. Spent over an hour with tech support VPNed to both my computer and phone so they could retrieve logs. They "escalated" the situation, but provided NO SOLUTION. I will now need to sort out errors manually via CSV exports, shutting down active sync, deleting contacts in the cloud and replacing all of my data. It will take hours. I am NOT HAPPY.
data.replyText:
Hi.
We're sorry for your inconvenience.
For further assistance, please contact this(sswitch.cs@samsung.com).
Thank you.

data.text: Auto installed at some point in the last 24 hours without a system update, would not let me uninstall unless I went to the play store. Has permissions to everything. **Edit: it seems that the app is being updated and turned back on, I am just able to uninstall the updates and kill it, like any other forced system app. Auto updates will keep doing this, you can turn them off here to get rid of this.
data.replyText: Please understand that the SmartSwitch app cannot be deleted due to Google permission issues. For app capacity issues, you can maintain the app with almost no available space by using the "Press and hold the SmartSwitch icon - exclamation point (!) - more (three dots on the right) - Delete update" menu.

data.text: Absolute joke of an app. I recently used it to transfer data (files, apps, settings, etc.) from an S20 to an S23. Should have been straightforward. Only about 20% of my apps were transferred, and only about half retaining any settings. So what should have taken 20 minutes took about 3 hours as I manually installed and configured apps, home and app screens, etc. I'd strongly recommend using a different app to transfer between phones. 2 stars instead of 1 cuz the wireless data transfer was fast.

Total crappola Samsung. One day my contacts just vanish. It's not Samsung or Smart Switch that restores them either - it's Google. Half the time I connect to my PC via USB, the phone remains unrecognized. Call Samsung support and they don't even know there's a bug that's been around for over 2 years. So they tell you to factory reset. So much for 'smart' switch.

They really should have called this Samsung Dumb Switch, because there's nothing smart about it. It gets to a very consistent percentage partway through the 'transfer', then the new phone says it lost connection. But the best part is that even after losing connection, it keeps running the old phone at full throttle until it overheats, and the only way to stop it is to use the app manager to force stop the app.
data.replyText: Hi. We're sorry for your inconvenience. If Smart Switch lose the connection, it does not increase heats any more. If the same problem continues, could you please contact to our email(sswitch.cs@samsung.com) for further assistance. Our team is going to try best to resovle it. Thank you.

data.text: Rewriting my review. Not bad but for each file or set of folders you must manually select folders, and some are of the data type that apparently won't be sent. New apps didn't transfer, but SMS and calls seemed to transfer well (except for my other non-default messaging app. To be expected). Please allow more seamless file transfer or an 'attempt to transfer all files' or similar imaging function. I didn't have time to manually push all the folder icons then push receive, but it was FAST! 4stars

App does not work. It goes great until it is time to actually transfer the data and then it says you need to connect to WiFi to do so, when the app on both phones has already connected them together with WiFi direct according to the data displayed under settings - connections - WiFi - "..." Menu - WiFi direct. I'm trying to copy my old Samsung S9 to my new S9 using a Samsung official app and yet it can't handle it. Edit: logs emailed! Will update. I used this app in '21 successfully btw.
data.replyText:
Hi.
We're sorry for your inconvenience.
It's hard to reproduce and check the symptom with your description only.
Please contact to our email(sswitch.cs@samsung.com) for further assistance.
Thank you.

data.text: This app helps make the switch from one Samsung device to another way easy by transferring pretty much everything from you old phone to your new one. Including apps, images, contacts, txt messages and most settings. You will have to go over everything manually just to make sure, but it beats having to do it all yourself. Just wish it would list in detail what it could not port to the new device. 1 star off for that.

No longer works. App not supported through galaxy store now as well. Used to be seamless and easy. Now phones won't connect on the same wifi. Quit being cheap. If a cable is required include one!!! The new charging cables would work after purchase but not included. I live an hour plus away from nearest retailer. Now I get to waste half a day traveling to get phones switched.
data.replyText: Hi. We're sorry for your inconvenience. It's hard to reproduce and check the symptom with your description only. Could you please explain the problem in more detail? Please contact to our email(sswitch.cs@samsung.com) for further assistance. Our team will try our best to solve your problem. Thank you.

data.text: What is the point of this if it doesn't really transfer what you want? Family member got a new S21+ phone. Tried to transfer all the app data and settings. All those Twitter and Facebook accounts you kept the passwords for in the phone? Not transferred. Scores in the games that you played and were stored locally on the device? Nope, can't do those either. All it gets is the Google account, photos, videos, and apps (and even those it just download again). Samsung has turned upgrading into hell.
data.replyText: Hi. We're sorry for your inconvenience. There are some constraints to transfer 3rd party app data. In the long run, we're trying to transfer them as well. Please contact to our email(sswitch.cs@samsung.com) if you have any help. Thank you.

data.text: I don't know why people are rating this app so low. I just switched my phone today and I had a seamless experience. That said: USE THE WIRED CABLE TO TRANSFER! I tried to transfer around 45GB from my old pixel 4a5g to my new z flip 4 and the wireless option took 3 hours to get 23% of that done. I switched to the cable method using the cable provided with the new phone and within 25 minutes everything was transferred. All my photos, videos, music, apps, Google account transferred seamlessy

This app is absolute garbage. It's time estimates are off by orders of magnitude. IT LITERALLY DRAINS ONE OF THE PHONES CONNECTED TO IT WITHOUT WARNING and there's no way to turn it off. Have 2 phones charged to 80%? don't worry, one of the phones with inefficiently sap power from the other until one dies before the transfer is done. And the only way to figure out it's happening is a tiny little sliver of a notification that once clicked makes you scroll ALL THE WAY to the bottom of the pop-up menu only to find out that you can switch the direction of the battery drain, but can't turn it off all together!!! I honestly want to know who shoehorned this stupid ripoff of a much better google pixel feature (you can turn it off completely) into this app and who approved it. Because it literally kills the ability to transfer data from an old phone to a new phone without a wireless charging puck.
data.replyText: Hi, We're sorry for unsatisfactory service. We'll strive to provide better service. Thank you.

data.text: I've used this in the past to transfer everything to a newer phone without any problems. But this time, it took more than 6 hours to transfer my stuff to the S23 from s9. It used to be no more than 2 hours. The apps that transferred didn't even install after all that time so I had to do it one by one. My contacts nor messages not transferred. Only thing that did transfer (after almost half the day) were my pictures.

I'm really disappointed in this app and do not recommend it. I used it recently to transfer all data from my my Galaxy Note 10+ to a new S22 Ultra. The process seemed to go just fine, and there were no errors. However, I discovered later that several apps and settings did not transfer to my new phone, which caused me to spend a lot of time figuring out what happened. For instance, I use and previously paid for multi instances of the Time Recording Pro (TRP) app. After the SS transfer, the TRP app no longer recognized my payment. After writing the TRP developer, I learned that Smart Switch did not transfer the required DynamicG utility plugin app that monitors the multi instance license, and I had to manually install it from the Play Store.
data.replyText: Hi, We're sorry for unsatisfactory service. We'll strive to provide better service. Thank you.

data.text: Did a good job moving apps, files, the few photos and videos that weren't on an SD card from new to old Samsung. Didn't work for text messages (1.4 GB, 28,000). I could transfer messages, but Smart Switch crashed dozens of times while "organizing" messages. Supposed fixes didn’t work. I also found the lack of visibility into processes frustrating… no % complete, no report of what’s moved or not. Instead I used SMS Backup and Restore for text messages, no problem, that worked great.

I've spent an entire week trying to get this to work properly. If I try wired, it fails at various points with "USB disconnected" when it was on a desk not being touched. So I decided to try 4 other cables and other older iPhones I had just to see. Same thing. At one point I got to literally 98.9% scanning and it said disconnected. So I tried iCloud, that yielded much much less data transferring over than I wanted, not to mention took 3 times before it worked. Guess this is why I stuck w/ Apple.
data.replyText:
Hi.
We're deeply sorry for that you're dissatisfied with our service. We'll strive to provide better services by continuous updates. We look forward your continued interest. Thank you.

data.text: I go to transfer all my photos and video over to my USB thumb drive where after an hour and 45 minutes it freezes at 73.4%..twice. The second time it only made it to 71.8%. It's ridiculous that I have to use an app to transfer files on a $800 phone. Why can't you just move the files over to the external like on a computer?? But that's what you get when you get rid of expandable storage on your flagship line of phones so your customers have to pay to use the cloud, huh samsung..

Does not transfer Meta data of any kind. All of my pictures are now time and location stamped with the transfer so they are all taken at the exact same time and place. It also didnt transfer a single app setting or login. Every app was like it was freshly downloaded with default preferences that aren't tied to an account. On top of that having them download through Smart Switch overwrites the notification sound irriverably to whatever your phone wide default sound is without reinstalling.

This app was like magic for me! I can hardly believe it transferred literally EVERYTHING including my text threads and even my apps, did it wirelessly, and did it so quickly! I did have a few initial problems making it work until it dawned on me that the app needs to be on BOTH phones, but after that it was EASY and FAST! 🙂 Edit: I noticed it didn't transfer my Notepad notes. ☹️

This app is ALMOST perfect. But recently they added a minimum if 20% of battery in order to do any transfer or backup. I understand the reason behind this but there should be a warning that can be bypassed. I tried transfering my data from an old device that does not charge past 3% but can still survive while plugged in. It's capable of a transfer but i cannot find a way because now the app does not let me.

Samsung screws the customer. Instead allowing the standard Google backup and restore, they blocked it and force you to use this useless piece of software. Restore on the new phone fails on wifi, and won't connect at all on USB C connection. I won't go through all the steps I have done to try and get it to work, abut each time the same result. Samsung, proprietary software was the 80's. Try to catch up.
data.replyText: Hi. We're sorry for your inconvenience. I think there is a need to analyze log files to find out the cause of problem. Could you please contact to our email(sswitch.cs@samsung.com) for further assistance ? Thank you.

data.text: Fast, easy and super convenient. Being able to switch over all your phone info from one phone to another this easily is priceless. It's bad enough I'm constantly breaking my phones, one drop and that's all she wrote. And I drop mine just about every time I get out of a vehicle. Its always tragic, maddening and annoying when ya break your phone, but at least thanks to this app it's that much easier to get your new phone up to date with what you had stored on your old phone. Thanks again Samsung.

Requires VPN to be turned off, which is very suspicious. Also, the interface needs some work. It's too easy to accidentally transfer something you don't want to transfer by simply browsing. Even if you don't select anything, when you go back, it will automatically select everything. The only reason for 2 stars instead of 1 is that it transfers very quickly.

It's okay. A good start, but I would expect that since Samsung won't let us root our phones, they would at least do the backup/restore/transfer (to another Samsung phone especially) correctly. They don't. There are many apps that don't transfer their data (db or files). It's absurd in 2019 I can't get a bit for bit backup of my phone! Not sure what this provides over Google's (equally disappointing) backups. Lame.

App does not let you choose what you transfer and I literally just wanted my contacts. Waste of my time. Response to response: it's not rocket science. If I couldn't figure it out quickly then it's still bad and I definitely wouldn't seek troubleshooting.I tried to change it multiple times when starting new device. You only get one chance with stuff that's supposed to be quick and easy. And to another comment, your problem is using Samsung apps. Google just works.
data.replyText: Hi. We're sorry for your inconvenience. Smart Switch provides user to choose each item. If you need help about this, please contact to our email(sswitch.cs@samsung.com) for further assistance. Our team will support you. Thank you.

data.text: Like so many other users, this is junk. 3 frustrating days and countless hours phone to PC, phone to phone (cord and WiFi)... Tried different PCs, different networks, reinstalled programs on all three devices, changed settings, tried to target specific data and was excited to see it finally "completed" (5 hrs later) only to discover it only copied some data in some categories?! Any alternative program is better than this. Dedicated Android user- will never will use this waste of time again!
data.replyText: Hi. We're really sorry for your inconvenience. There is a need to analyze log files to find out the cause and resolve it. Please contact to our email(sswitch.cs@samsung.com) for further assistance. Thank you.

data.text: This is one of the greatest apps ever invented. Thos app lets me switch over everything from one phone to another. When I upgraded my phone, I thought I was going to have to reinstall ALL my apps. NOPE!!! I just downloaded Smart Switch and in about 20 minutes, everything (apps, photos, documents, downloads, everything) was transfered to the new phone.

This app helps you make it easier, but a far cry from what's expected. None of the passwords are transferred and neither is something like your voicemail. If you have more than one location where your phone numbers are stored, you will end up with one mixed up list or having to reenter them manually, which is like not having this app anyway. Have used it on 2 phones and disappointed both times. Maybe it works better between Apple and Samsung, Note to Note, galaxy to Note, not so great.

Tried to use it to switch from my LG K51 to a Galaxy S10+. No option would work. Transferring by cable didnt work. Transferring by WiFi didn't work, just kept disconnecting. I was about to give up and look up an alternate transfer app, when I decided to use my USB-C adapter with a flash drive I had to transfer the data from my old phone. It was the only option that worked, but none of my app data was transferred, nor was the position of each app on the home screen transferred. Very unsatisfied.

The last time I had tried to use this app I was not impressed..it seemed to just randomly dump some of my apps on the new device, didn't sign me in didn't switch my googles. THIS TIME WAS SO MUCH BETTER!! Once I put both devices on same wifi it asked me what to send to new phone, and sent my contacts, all my text messages, my background my custom icons, all of it! Even my settings! The worst part of getting a new device is having to set it all up, this just saved me HOURS!!

Here is an important tip for Backup/Restore using external SSD/Drive, when you restore from external drive, at some point the app will tell that you can disconnect the external drive now and it'll work on installing all your backup apps in the background... DO NOT DISCONNECT. I've tried restoring by following its direction 3 times and every time majority of my apps were not installed(even though it said it did). On my last try before giving up I DID NOT disconnect my external SSD even when it prompted me that it's OK to disconnect. It took significantly longer to restore and finish this time but every app has been restored. 3 stars for wasting my time with incorrect direction but it eventually worked.

Appears to work great, but misses some things. It DID warn me of some data I had transfer manually, e.g. WhatsApp chat history - this is great. It did NOT warn me of Samsung app data that was not being transferred and would be lost if my old device was reset. Specifically, ECG data from Health app. It did NOT warn me I would have to re-setup all of my accounts. If transferring account credentials is not possible for security reasons, fine, but at least this app could guide the user through re-entering those credentials all at one time, during the setup process. Otherwise, what happened to me is that I didn't notice which apps weren't working any more until I had various breakdowns - missed meetings, emails, or deliverables for which I was relying on app notifications as reminders. Specifics: transferring data from Note 9 (ATT) to Note 10+ (unlokced) a 1wk ago; still using Watch 3.

It does do a good job of switching a lot of things over. But I'm giving it a 2 out of 5 because it aggressively does NOT switch over many other things. Like silent notifications. It seems to think that you really didn't want the camera shutter to be off. Or notifications to be silent. Or a hundred other little settings that took you two years to figure out and get just the way you wanted.

Didn't work wirelessly... Says couldn't connect. Uninstalling and using Google. Why use a separate app anyways? Update: I had to uninstall, then reinstall on both devices. It still stopped at 60% and I had to close and restart the app. I finally did get everything transferred, but not easily. BTW, Samsung's only support is through other users. There is no support from Samsung on a new flagship phone!
data.replyText:
Hi.
We're sorry for your inconvenience.
It's hard to reproduce and check the symptom with your description only.
Please contact to our email(sswitch.cs@samsung.com) for further assistance.
Thank you.

data.text: I switched from a much older phone to a new 5g samsung. This app worked surprisingly! I kept both phones close together and it finished. After finishing the new phone still needed time to populate the apps. I thought it had failed but some time later they started showing up until they were all there. The thing that sucks though is it will not copy app data. But it did copy everything else.

This app is perfect! I have used it many many times with no problems. The people who are having a problem with it must either be too dumb to use it properly, or they're using an old outdated devices with perhaps an old incompatible Android firmware versions or even app software versions! There are many other "dumb proof" methods you can use to transfer your files instead. Samsung cloud, Google cloud, onedrive, drop box.......etc are just few examples!

Awesome app. Have used this app numerous times as I tend to be very hard on phones & have had to get 3 new phones in less than a year. The only thing that was a disappointment was that I was unable to use the app on one of my phones as the screen was black & no way to get to Smart Switch app. I did try to connect/download onto my computer & then upload to my new phone but, unfortunately was unable to. Beyond that its been fantastic. We all know what a pain in the butt it is to get a new phone.

For the most part it's awesome. However, I do wish I had known that if copying from 2 different devices that it overwrites the previous backup instead of adding to it. I lost many years of notes bc of this. I had a note 8 and an S20+ I backed up to my note 20 ultra. I transfered the S20+ info second...I had already wiped my note and didn't realize my notes were not there until about a week later. Pretty sad about that. Perhaps there's a warning somewhere, I'll check, but add one if not.

A while ago, moving between Pixel phones, everything just worked. I love my Samsung phones, but this app has always been awful. This last time, I lost a lot of internal storage data, including podcasts, which I can't download again. Some apps didn't restore properly, so I had to clear data, including medication history, saved games. Some links to Play Store broke, so to restore purchases, I had to uninstall and reinstall apps. Please grant this app permissions to /Android/* and copy everything.
data.replyText: Hi. We're sorry for your inconvenience. When it comes to transferring app data, it depends on how each app implemented. It could be restored or not. Our team is trying best for apps to be restored as many as possible. If you need additional help, please contact to our email(sswitch.cs@samsung.com) for further assistance. Thank you.

data.text: This took over 2 hours. It got stuck at 82% for 30 min (all the while saying 1 min left), so I tried restarting it. Then it crashed 6 times at various points in the process. Then I restarted both phones, tried again, and it got stuck at 94% (with 1 min left). I let it go for 45 minutes (all at 1 min left), and then it finally finished a whole 2+ hours after I first started. I have never felt so gas lit by an app.
data.replyText: Hi. We're sorry for your inconvenience. We need a log file to find out the cause and resolve the problem. Please contact to our email(sswitch.cs@samsung.com) for further assistance. We're going to try our best to solve the problem. Thank you.
